Accomplishment: First wooden coaster built by Intamin
Notes: When opened it featured the longest drop in the world and fastest speed on a wooden coaster

Accomplishment: First ( and only ) Spacediver coaster
Location: Six Flags Great America , Six Flags Over Georgia , Six Flags Magic Mountain
Notes: Opened in '85 at Great America , was relocated to Over Georgia in '88 , then to Magic Mountain and opened there as Flashback in '92 ; demolished and scrapped in mid-December 2007 after sitting idle since 2003 First coaster to feature four-abreast seating

Accomplishment: First coaster to go above 300 ft ( 90 m ) First coaster to go 100 mph ( 160 km/h )
Notes: Not a complete circuit ; the train does not reach the top of the vertical spike

Accomplishment: First coaster with a structure to reach beyond 400 ft ( 120 m )
Notes: Not a complete circuit ; the train does not reach the top of the vertical spike ; formerly Superman : the Escape

Accomplishment: First LIM -launched inverted coaster First Impulse shuttle coaster
First complete-circuit , LIM-launched inverted coaster
Notes: Fastest inverted coaster at 70 mph ( 110 km/h ) when first opened

Accomplishment: First Giga Coaster ( over 300 ft ) First coaster to drop 300 ft ( 90 m )
Notes: First complete circuit coaster to stand over 300 ft ( 310 ft ) Drop is exactly 300 ft ( 90 m )

Accomplishment: First LIM-launched Twisted impulse coaster
Notes: Previously operated at Geauga Lake as Superman : Ultimate Escape and Steel Venom

Accomplishment: First Stand Up Drop Tower
Notes: 5 Towers with 3 stand up towers & 2 sit down towers Tower 5 was modified in 2002 to feature the Worlds First Stand Up Floorless drop tower

Accomplishment: First coaster to utilize a LIM launch hill
Notes: Has a magnetic launch followed by a magnetic non-cable/chain lift hill ( this , along with scream tunnels , was done to reduce noise ) Currently the longest coaster with inversions

Accomplishment: First wooden coaster with prefabricated track
First coaster to do 10 inversions
Notes: Has 10 inversions - in order : 1 Loop , 1 Cobra Roll ( counts as 2 ) , 2 Corkscrews , and 5 heartline rolls

Accomplishment: First hydraulic catapult launch coaster
Notes: Accelerates from 0 to 82 miles per hour , covering 157 feet of launch track , in just 2.3 seconds

Accomplishment: First Strata coaster ( over 400 ft )
Notes: Tallest and fastest coaster in the world when opened at 420 ft ( 128 m ) and 120 mph ( 190 km/h )

Accomplishment: First accelerator coaster to feature inversions
Notes: Reaches a height of 150 ft and catapults riders from 0 to 72 mph in 2 seconds Features a top hat and three inversions

Accomplishment: World 's tallest coaster ( 2005-present ) ; was world 's fastest coaster ( 2005-2010 )
Notes: 456 feet high ; launch speed 128 mph ( 206 km/h )

Accomplishment: First 4th Dimension design ZacSpin Coaster by Intamin First Intamin coaster to include curved hydraulic chain lift hill
Notes: First compact 4-D coaster in the world Features redesigned restraints ( lap bar with safety belt shoulder harness system ) and non-friction magnetic brakes

Accomplishment: Intamin 's first Wing Rider coaster
Notes: Accelerates from 0 to 135 km/h ( 84 mph ) in 3.5 seconds Was fastest coaster in Europe until 2017

Accomplishment: At 97 degrees , steepest drop of all Intamin coasters
Notes: Ascends chain lift hill at a 90 degree angle Features a 121-foot Norwegian loop and six inversions

Accomplishment: Record holder at the time for the steepest wooden coaster in the world Currently the highest , fastest , longest coaster in South Korea
Notes: Maximum 77 degrees Height 183.75 ft ( 56.01m ) Top speed 64.6 mph ( 104 km/h ) Length 5383.10 ft ( 1641m ) 12 airtime hills
